item.title: Lisa add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "For me to see is to read. It has always been that way." -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Daniel Gilbert
item.description: "The fact that we often judge the pleasure of an experience by its ending can cause us to make some curious choices." -- Daniel Gilbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Daniel Gilbert
item.description: "Psychologists call this habituation, economists call it declining marginal utility, and the rest of us call it marriage." -- Daniel Gilbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by David Ebershoff
item.description: "I must say a few words about memory. It is full of holes. If you were to lay it out upon a table, it would resemble a scrap of lace. I am a lover of history . . . [but] history has one flaw. It is a subjective art, no less so than poetry or music. . . . The historian writes a truth. The memoirist writes a truth. The novelist writes a truth. And so on. My mother, we both know, wrote a truth in The 19th Wifeâ€“ a truth that corresponded to her memory and desires. It is not the truth, certainly not. But a truth, yes . . . Her book is a fact. It remains so, even if it is snowflaked with holes." -- David Ebershoff

item.title: Lisa add a quote by David Ebershoff
item.description: "My duty, I know, is to lead. I cannot offer an array of options. I must offer a long but narrow path to Salvation, and guide the Saints down it. Were that path wide and varied, it would lead nowhere; and I will then have failed both God and man." -- David Ebershoff

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges
